Magic fans beware: Wizards appears to have forgotten the social aspect of the game. At its core, Magic: The Gathering is meant to be enjoyed with friends (or frenemies) - laughing, trash-talking, and dropping game-winning bombs. However, Wizards has seemingly overlooked this aspect in their digital version. If you choose to play with friends, you can't earn gold, and gold is crucial as it unlocks everything in the game. To make matters worse, they've implemented a daily cap on gold earnings, understandable given its importance. But get ready for a long and boring grind against the computer or random opponents, with whom you can't even communicate. Even playing for free will take you hours each day for weeks, if not months, to unlock the cards.

This paper presents a millimeter-scale CMOS 64$\times$64 single charged particle radiation detector system for external beam cancer radiotherapy. Entanglement is a crucial resource for quantum information processing. The idea is to imagine a machine that can simulate real life experiences while guaranteeing only pleasure and never pain. The experiment asks us to consider whether we would choose to sign up for such an existence, where our experiences would be indistinguishable from reality.

At first glance, the idea of a pleasure-only machine may seem appealing, as it would eliminate the unpleasantness and hardships that are inevitable parts of life. However, there are several reasons why I would not want to sign up for such an existence.

Firstly, while the machine may provide an endless series of pleasurable experiences, it would lack the richness and depth that come with experiencing life's ups and downs. Life is not just a series of pleasant moments, but also involves struggles, challenges, and growth. By removing the possibility of pain and hardship, the experience machine would rob us of the opportunity to learn and develop as individuals. We need to face challenges and overcome obstacles to gain wisdom, resilience, and a deeper understanding of ourselves and the world around us.
